text: Aharon Razin (Hebrew: אהרון רזין) (April 6, 1935 - May 27, 2019) was an Israeli biochemist. He was born in Tel Aviv. He won the Israel Prize in 2004 and the Wolf Prize in Medicine in 2008. Razin's works focused on the metabolism of nucleic acids and the biochemical faults in patients with gout.Emet prize winners Razin died on May 27, 2019 in Jerusalem at the age of 84.נפטר פרופ' אהרון רזין ז"ל ==References== Category:Wolf Prize winners Category:1935 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Israeli chemists Category:Scientists from Tel Aviv Category:Hebrew University of Jerusalem alumni Category:Hebrew University of Jerusalem faculty Category:Molecular biologists
title: Aharon Razin
